page.title: 09FARMING IN SANDAY
page.content: There are{ten farms}in our area of which{four are over 300 acres:- How, {Backaskail, Elsness}and{Hammerbrake. Most of the land is under grass and used for silage, hay and grazing. Oats and barley are grown for fodder. Most farms have both sheep and cattle. Breeds of{sheep}include{Suffolk, {Cheviot}and{Shetland,}and{cattle include{Friesians, Charolais}and {Herefords.}In this area there are{1690 {sheep}and about{950 cattle.}The farms have between two and six tractors each. The farm of How is a{dairy farm as well. It milks up to 12 cows and supplies milk to quite a lot of people on the island.
